intro: Dischidia cyclophylla, commonly known as the creeping fig, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and fleshy, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white, tubular flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in a variety of indoor conditions. Dischidia cyclophylla is also known for its ability to climb or trail along surfaces, making it a popular choice for hanging baskets and green walls.
